p: With advances in diagnostic technology, the rate of pathogen identification is higher in the current study than our previous study 10â€‰years ago (35.1 vs 22%) [ 1], and influenza A viruses remained the most common pathogen identified. Most studies reported that HRV was the commonest virus identified [ 6]. In contrast, relatively few studies reported influenza A as the most frequently found virus [ 20, 21].
